name: flaxseed
content:

the seeds of the flax plant (= a plant with blue flowers), which are eaten as food and used for making cooking oil: ground flaxseed Sprinkle a tablespoon of ground flaxseed on your cereal every morning. Finely grind a few tablespoons of flaxseeds in a blender. Compare
linseedSee also
flaxseed oil
More examplesFewer examplesMilled flaxseed is a good source of omega-3 fatty acids.The oil contains a blend of organic flaxseed, sunflower and sesame oils.Add flaxseed to bread, pancakes, and cookies for extra nutrition.Flaxseed contains high levels of lignin, which may protect against cancer.Adding flaxseeds to your diet can help to prevent heart disease.
